answers.answer: Hi,How is your father? Aside from MRI, what other tests were done? Are there other co-morbid conditions such as diabetes or hypertension? Headache, tingling and numbness are often associated with neuropathies or neurological issues. He may also benefit from further evaluation by a neurologist. Treatment will depend on the diagnosis. Complementary and alternative medicine such as acupuncture may also help. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: Hi,My father is 90, For the last Three and half years he is suffering from strong headache as well as strong numbness and heavy tingling on arms mostly well noticed when lifting something. So much test have been done including MRI Scan which the Doctor says sone blood veins are dry?. Is there a permanent cure for this problem? What can we do?
title: Strong Headache, Numbness and Tingling
